intro: Plagiobothrys granulatus, commonly known as the granulate sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. Plagiobothrys granulatus is adapted to arid environments and is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
